alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 28 at 4:31PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 530 PM PDT... At 431 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Chiriaco Summit, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Riverside County. This includes CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 89 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley
